p: For crude fat quantification in the feeding substrates, the Bligh and Dyer method [ 27] was used. 10 g of lyophilized feeding substrate was homogenized with 60 mL of chloroform-methanol (1:2; v/ v) solution. After adding 20 mL of chloroform and 40 mL of deionized water, the mixture was homogenized, filtered under vacuum, and the organic phase was collected and evaporated to dryness in a rotary evaporator; lipids were gravimetrically determined.
